Effects of the Rotation of the Earth
The sun, the moon and the stars seem to move from east to west
Rotation causes difference in time over various places on the earth
The side of the earth towards the sun constantly gains heat and the side away from the sun constantly loses heat by radiating it into outer space
the short rotational period makes the variation of temperature between day and night moderate.
Rotation in combination with Revolution (earth's movement round the sun) causes seasons and variations in the lengths of day and night over different places on earth

children.title: Richter Scale and the Mercalli Scale
Meaning, types and effects of weathering
Types: Physical Weathering - block and granular disintegration, exfoliation
Chemical Weathering - oxidation, carbonation, hydration and solution
Biological Weathering - caused by humans, plants and animals
Weathering involves disintegration or deca of solid rocks.
It depends on climatic elements and on the characteristics of rocks.
Weathering affects the surface of the earth.
Weathering involves not one but several processes to cause disintegration of rocks.
Weathering changes hard massive rocks into finer materials.
It prepares rock materials for transportation by agents of gradation.
In Equatorial climates, humidity and temperature are constantly high.
In Tropical climates, there is a marked dry season and wet season.
In Dry climates or deserts, mechanical weathering is most dominant due to high diurnal range of temperature.
In Mid-latitudes or Temperate Climates, the most powerful agent of weathering is the frost action.
In Polar climates, physical weathering due to frost action is more prevalent.
